Bruce Lee's friendship with other Hollywood actors of color, such as James Coburn, played a significant role in shaping his career. Coburn, who was a close friend of Lee, helped him in getting his first leading role in the movie "The Big Boss" in 1971. This role gave Lee his breakthrough as an actor and established him as the top martial arts star in the world.

Apart from this, Coburn also helped Lee in developing his fighting style, which was a fusion of different martial arts disciplines. Coburn introduced Lee to different martial arts experts, including Dan Inosanto, who helped him in mastering different fighting styles, such as Jeet Kune Do, Kung Fu, and Wing Chun.

Moreover, Coburn helped Lee in writing and developing the script for his second movie, "Fist of Fury," in which Lee played the lead role as Chen Zhen. The movie was a big hit and further cemented Lee's position as a global superstar.

Overall, Bruce Lee's friendship with other Hollywood actors of color, such as James Coburn, played a crucial role in shaping his career, from getting his first leading role in the movie to developing his unique fighting style and producing successful movies.
